title: Socialist Workers Party of Hungary
text:
The Socialist Workers Party of Hungary () was a <a href="political%20party">political party</a> in <a href="Hungary">Hungary</a>. The party was founded by <a href="social%20democrats">social democrats</a> and <a href="communists">communists</a> in 1925, and led by <a href="Istv%C3%A1n%20V%C3%A1gi">István Vági</a>. Unlike the established <a href="Hungarian%20Social%20Democratic%20Party">Hungarian Social Democratic Party</a>, the Socialist Workers Party sought to mobilize mass movements and agrarian struggles.
<a href="Imre%20Nagy">Imre Nagy</a>, the future <a href="Prime%20Minister%20of%20Hungary">prime minister</a> and leader of the <a href="Hungarian%20Revolution%20of%201956">1956 Revolution</a>, was involved in organizing the underground MSZMP chapter in his home town of <a href="Kaposv%C3%A1r">Kaposvár</a>. The <a href="Hungarian%20Socialist%20Workers%27%20Party">Hungarian Socialist Workers' Party</a> he helped establish during the Revolution was similarly named.
The right-wing government of <a href="Mikl%C3%B3s%20Horthy">Miklós Horthy</a> cracked down on the party in 1928. Its leaders, such as Vági and <a href="M%C3%A1ty%C3%A1s%20R%C3%A1kosi">Mátyás Rákosi</a> were arrested and sentenced to one year in prison.
